page.title: 16THE QUARRY
page.content:
Just north of Wiveliscombe, there is a quarry which we visited on 21 June 1985. To get to the quarry, you drive along muddy tracks towards Whitefield.
Then you walk along a wooded valley and up a steep hill. There are piles of shale all round the top of the quarry. You can see these from some distance off. Near the top of the quarry is a broad track. Along this carts and waggons were pulled about 100 years ago.
The quarry itself is all overgrown. You have to be very careful climbing down into it because the path is steep and slippery. At the bottom of the quarry is a huge pool, very deep. I saw a water snake swimming around.
